intro: Acer floridanum var. longii, commonly known as the Florida maple, is a deciduous tree native to the southeastern United States. It typically grows to a height of 10–20 feet and features slender, weeping branches that create a distinctive, cascading appearance. The leaves are palmately lobed, with a bright green upper surface and a pale white or yellowish underside. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers in early spring, followed by winged seeds that are dispersed by wind. This species is adapted to moist, acidic soils and is often found in swampy areas and along stream banks.
